bibl.title: Tomb T13 in the Ancient Roman Harbor Town of Marina el-Alamein - a Special Burial Place.
bibl.note: In a reconsideration of the burials from the western chamber of T13, which is a hypogeum tomb situated in the necropolis of the Roman harbor town of Marina el-Alamein on the Mediterranean coast of Egypt, discusses the evidence that could point to a special character of the burials in this chamber, possibly with links to Crete and ancient Greek eschatological beliefs. The suggested dating for the burials is the first half of the 2nd century. - 1. Introduction. - 2. Location and architecture. - 3. The burials in the western chamber. - 4. The grave goods. - 5. Discussion of the finds. - 6. Concluding remarks. - Avec résumés en anglais et en polonais.

bibl.title: Non solum villae. Księga jubileuszowa ofiarowana Profesorowi Stanisławowi Medekszy.

bibl.seg: Iwona Zych, Tomb T13 in the Ancient Roman Harbor Town of Marina el-Alamein - a Special Burial Place.
Jacek Kościuk (ed.), Non solum villae. Księga jubileuszowa ofiarowana Profesorowi Stanisławowi Medekszy (Wrocław, 2010) pp. 329-343, 6 figg.

In a reconsideration of the burials from the western chamber of T13, which is a hypogeum tomb situated in the necropolis of the Roman harbor town of Marina el-Alamein on the Mediterranean coast of Egypt, discusses the evidence that could point to a special character of the burials in this chamber, possibly with links to Crete and ancient Greek eschatological beliefs. The suggested dating for the burials is the first half of the 2nd century. - 1. Introduction. - 2. Location and architecture. - 3. The burials in the western chamber. - 4. The grave goods. - 5. Discussion of the finds. - 6. Concluding remarks. - Avec résumés en anglais et en polonais.
